meanings.definition: A person or animal that gallops.
meanings.sent1: The gallopers raced across the field.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of gallopers at the ranch.
meanings.sent3: The gallopers in the race were all very fast.
meanings.sent4: The herd of gallopers resembled a flowing river.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the gallopers echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: A type of amusement park ride.
meanings.sent1: The children enjoyed riding the gallopers at the fair.
meanings.sent2: The gallopers at the carnival were colorful and fun.
meanings.sent3: The gallopers spun around in circles, making everyone dizzy.
meanings.sent4: The lights on the gallopers created a magical atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The music on the gallopers added to the excitement of the ride.

meanings.definition: A group of people or animals that gallop together.
meanings.sent1: The gallopers in the race crossed the finish line together.
meanings.sent2: A herd of gallopers galloped through the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The gallopers in the parade moved in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent4: The gallopers on the beach kicked up sand as they ran.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized gallopers performed a stunning routine.
